thread.title: Down 22-0, Gibbs rallies to beat Carter - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Down 22-0, Gibbs rallies to beat Carter - PrepXtra Story

author: Heath Cox
title: Down 22-0, Gibbs rallies to beat Carter - PrepXtra
text:
After a challenge from coach Brad Conley at halftime, Gibbs High School’s football team scored 26 unanswered points in the second half to defeat visiting Carter 26-22 on Friday night.
“Somebody make a play,” Conley said was the message he told his players. “We just need to settle down and make plays.”
The Eagles responded to the challenge.
Down 22-19 in the fourth quarter, quarterback Zack Beeler found an open Nathan Whitt in the middle of the field on fourth-and-7. The reception set up a go-ahead 11-yard touchdown by Desanta Smith.
Several other players stepped up in the second half to get the Eagles in position.
With less than six minutes to play in the third quarter, senior J.C. Velez set up the Eagles (4-5) for their first touchdown. Velez took an inside run 40 yards. Wyatt Humphries finished the drive with a 4-yard touchdown to cut the deficit to 22-7.
A three-and-out by the Hornets (4-5) led to a quick drive by Gibbs. Smith scored from three yards out and the Eagles trailed 22-13 after an unsuccessful two-point conversion attempt.
After a fumble inside the Carter 1-yard line, Gibbs almost lost hope for a comeback. That was until Demarcus Hight intercepted a deep throw from Carter quarterback DeAngelo Brooks on third down.
A 27-yard run by Dalton Rodgers set up Humphries’ second touchdown of the game.
Carter fumbled in its own territory on the ensuing possession to set up Smith’s go-ahead score.
In the second quarter, Gibbs intercepted a Brooks pass and the Eagles were inside Hornets’ territory for the first time. However, a dropped handoff led to a fumble in the backfield, and Carter linebacker Benjamin Flowers scooped the ball and returned it 62 yards for a touchdown. After a two-point conversion, Carter led 14-0.
After another Gibbs fumble inside its 15, Carter scored on a 1-yard touchdown run from Brooks. Again, Carter managed to score a two-point conversion to lead 22-0 at halftime.
Heath Cox is a freelance contributor.
Gibbs 26, Carter 22
Carter 6 16 0 0 — 22
Gibbs 0 0 7 19 — 26
Scoring: C—Isaac Scarbrough 4 run (kick failed); C—Benjamin Flowers 62 fumble recovery (Jake Riley pass from DeAngelo Brooks); C—Brooks 1 run (Bailey Sivyer run); G—Wyatt Humphries 4 run (Logan Wolfenbarger kick); G—Desanta Smith 3 run (kick failed); G—Humphries 3 run (pass failed); G—Smith 11 run (Wolfenbarger kick)
Records: Carter 3-6, Gibbs 5-4
